subject: Re: Is Junit-based testing REALLY possible for commercial software development ?
msgSnippet: ... similiar ... [Frank] Thanks for this information. I ll take a look what is happerning there. ... tests in ... a short ... programming, ... [Frank] Good
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mark Levison <mlevison@...> wrote:


> * Some guys say JUnit is good for biz / util code testing. But for web
> > application development, where HTML/javascript would be root cause of
> > lots of bugs, Junit is not so powerful. Any comments ?
>
>
> Lots of people do this sort of testing FIT (http://fit.c2.com/) or
similiar
> frameworks. I don't know much about it since I've never done javascript.
>

[Frank] Thanks for this information. I'll take a look what is
happerning there.


> * How can I convince managers and programmers that JUnit-based is
> > really possible for commercial software development ? Any differnece
> > from open-source projects ?
>
>
> Show them the number of replies on this list? Also start writing
tests in
> you're own corner of the world. Integrate them into your build. Give
a short
> live demo at lunch. Bring you're co-workers in for some pair
programming,
> .....
>

[Frank] Good points. I've already invited some of my team members join
this mail list. hehe. :)

Cheers.
- Frank
